Our Expertise

Spouse Visa
If you have been convicted of an offence and sent to prison for more than 12 months then you will be subject to automatic deportation. There are however exceptions and we would strongly advise you seeking our professional advice in this area.
Learn more
arrow_outward
British Nationality
British citizenship is a type of British nationality as defined by the British Nationality Act 1981. However, British citizenship is not the only type of British nationality. The British Nationality Act also created other forms of British nationality, these include: British overseas territories citizen.
Learn more
arrow_outward
Application to enter UK
In the UK, all visa nationals require entry clearance to enter the UK, regardless of the length or purpose of their stay, even if only as a tourist. In particular, you will need entry clearance if you are a person specified in Appendix 2 to Appendix V of the Immigration Rules, namely a national who needs a visa to visit the UK, or for any other purposes, where seeking entry for six months or less.
Learn more
arrow_outward
Entry clearance as a visitor
Under UK Immigration Rules, if you are a foreign national coming to the United Kingdom as either a visitor, to work or study, or with the intention of settling here temporarily or permanently, you will usually need to apply for entry clearance before you travel and attempt to enter the UK.
Learn more
arrow_outward
Immigration and Asylum
Asylum is a form of protection which allows an individual to remain in the United States instead of being deported to a country where he or she fears persecution or harm.
Learn more
